data.benefits: Scheme provides assistance to each of the start-up will be up to Rs. 700 lakhs against equity held by the Partner.
data.eligibility: Biotech Startups and entrepreneurs are eligible under this scheme.
data.beneficiaries: All small and medium enterprises and startups are eligible for financial assistance through its AIF Daughter fund.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to foster R&D and innovation in Biotechnology domains (including areas such as healthcare, pharma, medical devices, agriculture, sanitation to name a few).
data.objective: The main objective of accelerating entrepreneurs is to foster research & development and innovation by encouraging venture capital investments for biotech startups through daughter funds.
data.description: Scheme provides assistance to each of the start-up will be up to Rs. 700 lakhs against equity held by the Partner.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply through the link : https://birac.nic.in/login.php
data.funding_mechanism: The applicants will get the incentives after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.highlights:
Impact of AcE Fund Scheme :
No of AcE Partners: 10
No. of Companies Supported under AcE: 49
AcE Fund Corpus Size: 150 Cr
Mobilized Amount in Biotech Sector: 349 Cr
data.checklist_info_a:
1.) Udyam Registration certificate
2.) Utilization certificate
3.) Statements of Accounts
4.) Copies of Annual audited accounts for preceeding 3 years (depending on the date of establishment of fund)
5.) Copies of Annual Reports for preceeding 3 years (depending on the date of establishment of fund)
6.) KYC documents
data.checklist_info_d:
Address : Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), 5th Floor, NSIC Business Park, NSIC Bhawan, Okhla Industrial Estate, New Delhi - 110020
E-mail address: birac[dot]dbt[at]nic[dot]in
Website address: www.birac.nic.in
Phone: +91-11-29878000
Fax: +91-11-29878111
data.beneficiary: Biotechnology Industries-Partnership, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP), Private Limited Company-All Locations-SMEs
